title: Proceedings in Karnataka courts seriously affected as advocates stay away
title_page: Proceedings in Karnataka courts seriously affected as advocates stay away | Bengaluru News - Times of India
text: BENGALURU: Proceedings in various courts across the state, including the Karnataka high court was seriously affected on Wednesday as advocates stayed away. This was in response to a resolution passed by the Karnataka State Bar Council KSBC ) the advocates to abstain from courts in terms of the resolution passed on September 27, in the aftermath of sudden resignation of senior judge Justice Jayant Patel In many of the courts , as advocates stayed away from courts, only litigants were present and the judges were seen adjourning the cases .Only a couple of cases wherein parties themselves argued their cases were taken up for consideration at the high court. Similar situation prevailed at the lower courts as well as tribunals and revenue courts as well.In their resolution, the KSBC had asked the advocates to abstain from appearing in their respective courts on Wednesday, October 4 ,2017 , as a mark of ‘protest’ and to vindicate the independence of judiciary and also to restore the faith in the system in the light of NJAC verdict having sought for transparency in collegium, appointment of judges independence of judiciary.Meanwhile, the Advocates Association of Bengaluru has also supported the call given by KSBC.H C Shivaramu, president of AAB told reporters that apart from protesting against the treatment meted out to Justice Jayant Patel, the association is also deeply concerned about dwindling strength judges at the Karnataka high court with only 25 judges against a sanctioned strength of 62 while urging for immediately filling vacant posts of judges at the Karnataka high court.He also said that they would protest in front of Jantar-Mantar in New Delhi if the demand for appointing judges to Karnataka high court is not fulfilled.
